narrative.narrative: Zambian Airways,not to be confused with Zambia Airways which operated from 1964 to 1995, was the flag carrier of Zambia from 1948 to January 2009. Its base was Lusaka. It operated at 5 other domestic airports and went to Johannesburg,South Africa Dar es Salaam,Tanzania and Lubumbashi,Republic of the Congo also. At the end it had three 737-200 Adv.'s, of which two were leased from Safair of South Africa, and also two Beechcraft 1900D's which it had since 1998. At founding it was part of the Zambia Consolidated Copper Mines as Mines Air Services Limited. The airline was stripped of its mining ties in 1998 during the privatisation of the countries mining sector.
